TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit CompareProjectProperty extends System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity implements class System.Workflow.ComponentModel.IActivityEventListener`1<class System.Workflow.ComponentModel.QueueEventArgs>
Public NotInheritable Class CompareProjectProperty Inherits Activity Implements IActivityEventListener(Of QueueEventArgs)
type CompareProjectProperty = class inherit Activity interface IActivityEventListener<QueueEventArgs>

Docs.summary: The workflow activity that compares the specified project property with another value.

remarks.para: The property comparison is made based on the type of the specified property. The property type can be text, numeric, date-time, duration, or flag (a Boolean value). If the MdPropUid property GUID is specified, the PropertyName value is ignored.
The Workflow Designer pane and the Properties pane in Microsoft Visual Studio 2010 enable you to get and set properties in fields for the CompareProjectProperty activity.
For an example that uses the CompareProjectProperty activity and sets properties for the comparison, see How to: Create a Branching Workflow.

Docs.param: Represents the execution environment of a Project Server workflow activity.

Docs.returns: An enumerated value that corresponds to the status of an activity within a running workflow instance.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Guid CodePropertyValue { Guid get(); void set(Guid value); };
member this.CodePropertyValue : Guid with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the GUID of the code property, such as a selection in a lookup table.

remarks.para: If the project property specified is a code value, CodePropertyValue is the value that is used in the comparison. If the specified property is not a code value, CodePropertyValue is ignored.

Docs.summary: Contains the CodePropertyValue property.

remarks.para: The property is the GUID of a code value, such as a selection in a lookup table.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Project::Server::Library::ProjectPropertyCompareOperator CompareOperator { Microsoft::Office::Project::Server::Library::ProjectPropertyCompareOperator get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Project::Server::Library::ProjectPropertyCompareOperator value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the property comparison operator.
Docs.value: An operator that compares project properties.

Docs.summary: Contains the CompareOperator property for comparing two properties.

remarks.para: The property can be one of the constants in the enumeration.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ConditionValid { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.ConditionValid : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the condition is valid.
Docs.value: True if the comparison condition is valid; otherwise, False.

Docs.summary: Contains the ConditionValid property, which indicates when a comparison condition is valid.

remarks.para: The property value is False until it is bound to a property in the Workflow Designer in Microsoft Visual Studio 2010. The value then includes the name of the workflow and the path name of the property for comparison.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property DateTime DateTimePropertyValue { DateTime get(); void set(DateTime value); };
member this.DateTimePropertyValue : DateTime with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the DateTime value used in the property comparison.

remarks.para: If the project property specified by PropertyName or MdPropUid is a DateTime value, DateTimePropertyValue is the value that is used in the comparison. If the specified property is not a DateTime value, DateTimePropertyValue is ignored.

Docs.summary: Contains the DateTimePropertyValue property.

remarks.para: The specifies the DateTime value used in the property comparison.

In the Properties pane of a workflow activity, the DateTimePropertyValue property can be the name of the workflow and path name of the property for comparison. The property value can also be a date selected in the date picker control or typed by the user, such as 5/11/2012.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ DurationPropertyValue { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.DurationPropertyValue : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the String value of the duration used in the property comparison.

remarks.para: An example duration is "3d" for three days.

If the project property specified by PropertyName or MdPropUid is a duration value, DurationPropertyValue is the value that is used in the comparison. If the specified property is not a duration value, DurationPropertyValue is ignored.

Docs.summary: Contains the DurationPropertyValue property.

remarks.para: The specifies the duration value used in the property comparison, for example, "3d" for three days.
In the Properties pane of a workflow activity, the DurationPropertyValue property can be the name of the workflow and path name of the property for comparison.

member this.FlagPropertyValue : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the Flag property used in the comparison.
Docs.value: The Boolean value of the flag.

remarks.para: If the project property specified is a Boolean value, FlagPropertyValue is the value that is used in the comparison. If the specified property is not a Boolean value, FlagPropertyValue is ignored.

In the Properties pane of a workflow activity, the FlagPropertyValue property can be the name of the workflow and path name of the property for comparison.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Guid MdPropUid { Guid get(); void set(Guid value); };
member this.MdPropUid : Guid with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the GUID of the project property to compare. Not required if PropertyName is specified.

remarks.para: In the Properties pane of a workflow activity, the MdPropUid property can be the name of the workflow and path name of the GUID property for comparison. If MdPropUid is a non-null and non-empty value, PropertyName is ignored.

Docs.summary: Contains the MdPropUid property, which is the GUID of the project property to compare.

remarks.para: For example, the property can be the GUID of a custom field.
In the Properties pane of a workflow activity, the MdPropUid property can be the name of the workflow and path name of the property for comparison.
If MdPropUid is a non-null and non-empty value, PropertyName is ignored.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the Number property used in the comparison.

remarks.para: If the project property specified by PropertyName or MdPropUid is a numeric value, NumericPropertyValue is the value that is used in the comparison. If the specified property is not a numeric value, NumericPropertyValue is ignored.

Docs.summary: Contains the NumericPropertyValue property, which is the numeric value of the property to compare.

remarks.para: The specifies the numeric value used in the property comparison.
In the Properties pane of a workflow activity, the NumericPropertyValue property can be the name of the workflow and path name of the property for comparison.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ PropertyName { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.PropertyName : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the property used in the comparison.
Docs.value: A string that contains the name of the property.

remarks.para: If a non-null and non-empty MdPropUid value is specified, PropertyName is ignored.

Docs.summary: Contains the PropertyName property, which is the name of the project property to compare.

remarks.para: The specifies the name of the project property for comparison. The property can be one of the following properties in the drop-down list in the Properties pane:

In the Properties pane of a workflow activity, the PropertyName property can also be the name of the workflow and path name of the property for comparison. If a non-null and non-empty MdPropUid value is specified, PropertyName is ignored.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the Text property used in the comparison.

member this.WaitUntilValueIsSet : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the project property comparison waits until the property value is set.
Docs.value: True if the project property comparison waits until the property value is set; otherwise, False.

remarks.para: The default value of the WaitUntilValueIsSet property is False.

Docs.summary: Contains the WaitUntilValueIsSet property.

remarks.para: The value of the WaitUntilValueIsSet property can be True or False.
In the Properties pane of a workflow activity, the WaitUntilValueIsSet property can also be the name of the workflow and path name of the property for comparison.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Project::Server::Library::ProjectWorkflowContext ^ WorkflowContext { Microsoft::Office::Project::Server::Library::ProjectWorkflowContext ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Project::Server::Library::ProjectWorkflowContext ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the context of the CompareProjectProperty activity in the parent workflow activity.
Docs.value: An object that contains information that is related to the current instance of the workflow

remarks.para: The WorkflowContext property includes the name of the parent ProjectSequence activity instance and the path name of the WorkflowContext property in the parent activity. For example, if a CompareProjectProperty activity occurs within a ProjectSequence activity named projectSequence1, the Properties pane would show the WorkflowContext value as Activity=projectSequence1, Path=WorkflowContext.

Docs.summary: Contains the WorkflowContext property, which is the context of the CompareProjectProperty activity in the parent ProjectSequence activity.

remarks.para: The WorkflowContext property includes the name of the parent ProjectSequence activity instance and the path name of the WorkflowContext property. For example, the Properties pane can show the WorkflowContext value of a CompareProjectProperty activity as Activity=projectSequence1, Path=WorkflowContext.
